alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Somerset, southwestern Worcester and north central Accomack Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Snow Hill to near Pocomoke City to near Marion Station. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Saxis, Horntown, Shelltown, Sanford, Oak Hall, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Beaver Dam, Girdletree, Stockton and New Church. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in Ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
